Falters at times: The claim falters at times because it is based on conflicting statements and interpretations from different sources.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it relies on statements from individuals without providing concrete evidence or documentation.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that former Ukraine President Petro Poroshenko actively worked for Secretary Clinton without providing substantial evidence to support this claim.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim has an alternative explanation as it is contradicted by the statement of the Ukrainian Anti-Corruption Bureau Director, who denied any interference in the 2016 presidential election.
Understate: The claim may understate the complexity of the situation by simplifying it to the actions of one individual, without considering the broader context or involvement of other parties.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the Ukrainian Anti-Corruption Bureau Director denied any government agencies meddling in the 2016 presidential election.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the influence and involvement of Petro Poroshenko in actively working for Secretary Clinton without providing sufficient evidence to support this claim.
